intro: Ouratea bukobensis, commonly known as the Bukoban ouratea, is a flowering plant species native to Tanzania. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
